title: For Sale/Trade:  Sig sauer 522 TARGET model. 20" bull barrel.
postcontent: Sig 522 target model for sale, not to be confused with the common base model the "swat". Was bought new and had around 400 rounds shot through it in one session, zero malfunctions. Was cleaned before and after being fired as well as oiled. This is the target model which comes with a 20 inch "bull barrel" and a free float forend hand guard. It's a "Swiss" style stock which folds and locks to the side and a Swiss style hand guard. Hand guard has 3 removable picatinny rails and includes a grip/bipod combo. The upper receiver is made of aircraft grade aluminum with. Full length picatinny rail on top. It is currently equipped with iron sights which are removable. The lower is a polymer lower with a 2 stage trigger assembly with a 3 1/2 lb pull. The upper and lower break apart like a traditional ar15 with the 2 takedown pins. Has a bolt lock open similar to ar style, same location different style. Bolt sides out from the back of the upper like you'd expect and the take down of the rifle makes for very easy, and detailed cleaning. There are 2 storage compartments in the gun. One is a tube above the barrel where the mock gas block is and the other is in the pistol grip and has a cover on both. 4 points from which you can attach a sling. 1:16 barrel twist. 2000 rounds of assorted .22 ammo. No cheap bulk in the bunch though. Contact me through email or phone. Text before 5 you can call after 5 if you prefer REDACTED. If you have any questions also feel free to contact me.  Long gun transfers between states that adjoin are legal if both residents can legally own firearm. I'm willing to come to mobile as I live right on the state line.

title: For Sale:  Attention Collectors: Vintage Shot Shells
postcontent:
Winchester Repeater Super Speed 20 gauge 2 3/4'' roll-crimp paper shot shells. 
Top of box indicates 1 ounce No. 5 chilled shot. Front indicates long range short shot string and states "Progressive Burning Smokeless Powder. STAYNLESS." 
Shells are high brass and in excellent condition for their age. 
Box exhibits slight bulging and some fading. Flaps are intact and all of the writing on the box is clearly legible. 
An inside flap advertises the Winchester model 12, model 97 and model 21. With these three guns in production, the date of this box would fit between 1930 and 1957. It is probably closer to the 1930 end of the spectrum and probably pre WWII. Nice gun room display or for the ammo box collector.

16 rounds of 2 1/4'' 20 Gauge Remington Shur Shot shot shells. 
Headstamp reads: "REM-UMC" at top and "SHURSHOT" at bottom. 
Side reads: "USE IN 20 GAUGE ONLY" and "SHURSHOT KLEANBORE".
These corrugated shells are paper pie-crimp shot shells with top covers and low brass. 
Original box is in good plus shape with intact flaps. Minimal fraying at edges. 

Peters Victor vintage shot shells that are near mint in 16GA (4) and 20GA (4). 
Peters Victor 16 Gauge Paper Shotgun Shells, 2 3/4'', 1 Piece Full Correct, Made in USA headstamp. Antique ammunition. # 8 shot. 
Peters Victor 20 Gauge Rustless Paper Shotgun Shells, 2 1/2", 1 Piece Full Correct
Made in USA headstamp. Antique ammunition. #8 shot. 
Both the 20 gauge and the 16 gauge are paper with top covers. 

These are old shells and probably should not be fired in your shotgun. All ammunition is for collecting/decorative purposes only and I in no way guarantee or imply them to be functional in anyway other than collecting or decorative purposes.

Payment: 
Local buyers - cash FTF.  Will drive a reasonable distance to meet. 
Out of State - money order pre pay or PayPal off a checking account.  
Out of state buyers pay shipping (should be less than $15 to most states).

Will include an older empty Remington Peters box with above.

title: For Sale:  Sino-Soviet SKS
postcontent:
For sale one early Sino-Soviet milled SKS rifle in Very good ++ condition.

These early Type 56 rifles were produced by China factory 26 (in triangle) but with cooperation from Russian "advisors" who helped regulate the factories and provided the design specifications. Much of the parts used for these builds came from existing Russian stockpiles and were thought to be put together on Russian equipment and tooling. 

This example has ALL MATCHING PARTS and has particularly nice wood, metal and bluing as well as the chrome bore.  Still has a cosmoline film so it has not been shot since imported. Cleaning kit still in buttstock. More pictures at the following link: 


http://s233.photobucket.com/user/pilot1950/library/Sino-Soviet%20SKS


$350 or best reasonable offer.

Will consider shipping to FFL at your expense.

title: For Sale:  Heckler & Koch USP 40 compact
postcontent:
14-8572 Used Heckler & Koch 40S&W Compact includes original box and three magazines.


USP COMPACT
The HK USP Compact is a small frame pistol capable of firing the most powerful cartridges in 9 mm, .40 S&W, .45 ACP, and .357 SIG (by special order). Based on the full-size USP models, these handy pistols combine compact size with optimum effective shooting performance.

USP Compacts are smaller and lighter than large frame USPs. The reduction in trigger reach and grip circumference increases concealability and enhances shooting ergonomics. Unlike some subcompact semiautomatic pistols that use a difficult to shoot "two-finger grip" frame, the USP Compact uses a narrow, full-hand grip frame with a choice of interchangeable extended or flush-fitting magazine floorplates. This makes the pistol easy to shoot without sacrificing concealability.

Like their large frame predecessors, USP Compacts are designed with the demanding needs of the law enforcement and military shooters in mind. Using a modified linkless Browning-type action, the USP Compact is built to take the punishment of high-energy +P loads.

To reduce the length of the slide and barrel on the USP Compact, the mechanical recoil reduction system found on large frame USPs has been replaced by a specially designed flat compression spring contained in the captive recoil spring assembly by a polymer absorber bushing. Service life is still engineered to exceed 20,000 rounds.

Easy to shoot, simple to maintain; the USP Compact is a reliable, safe, accurate, and highly concealable pistol.

Features & System Characteristics:
Corrosion proof fiber-reinforced polymer frame
Grooved target triggers
Polygonal bore profile for increased velocity, easier cleaning, and longer barrel life
Can be converted to any of nine trigger firing modes
Specially designed captive recoil spring assembly with polymer absorber bushing
Choice of corrosion resistant “Hostile Environment” blued finish or stainless steel slide
One piece machined slide made from nitro-carburized steel
No snag, bobbed hammer
Flared recurve trigger guard
Choice of flat and extended floorplate magazines
Universal mounting grooves for installing accessories
Ambidextrous magazine release lever
Contoured, extended slide release
Extractor doubles as a loaded chamber indicator
Patented Lock-Out Safety device

Windsor, CO 80550

title: For Sale:  Anti-Personnel 44 Mag. Ammo - 200 gr. Hard Cast Wadcutter (1,300 fps) - 20 Round Box
postcontent:
http://extreme-impact-ammo.com/index.php?l=product_detail&p=283

This full profile wad cutter hard cast 44 magnum load was designed for the owners of 44 magnum firearms that choose to use those firearms for self defense against humans. This load is specifically designed to permanently and quickly disable humans. The big flat wad cutter nose crushes living tissue, unlike mushroomed bullets that are slightly rounded on the nose and tend to slip and slide through living tissue. The crushing action of the flat nose keeps penetration straight and when penetration is straight, it is generally very deep—deep enough to obtain full penetration on the largest human from any angle. The hard cast nose will not deform at these velocities so the nose profile remains constant (flat, with a sharp shoulder) along with bullet path and terminal damage. Noted NYPD “stake out” officer Jim Cirillo used full profile wad cutters in his 38 SPL revolvers because they incapacitated his human targets with certainty. See our item 20D. (38 SPL) The light weight bullet at moderate velocity aids in low recoil for fast follow-up shots.

Unlike our other Anti-Personnel 44 magnum loads, this one utilizes a hard cast bullet, which will not mushroom and the resulting penetration is very deep. Expect at least 24 inches of straight-line penetration in mammalian tissue, thus allowing this load to also serve well on small to medium sized game such as deer, black bear and even elk. This hard cast construction keeps your bore from being substantially lead fouled even after hundreds of rounds.

We’ve utilized a flash suppressed powder to the shooter will not be blinded by his/her own gunfire should you be required to drop the hammer in low light.

Note our real world velocities taken from stock over-the-counter firearms. We prefer to establish advertised velocities from real-world firearms and not from extra long laboratory test barrels that give false high velocities. You know what you are getting in the real world, where it matters, with Buffalo Bore ammunition.

title: For Sale:  Gerber Propel AO
postcontent:
Up for sale is the Gerber Propel AO. It's brand NEW never used. I accidentally ordered the wrong knife. I meant to order the Propel Auto. Since then i have ordered the correct one. I'm asking $100 FIRM. After my cost and shipping, I'm taking a small hit. I'm just trying to get some of my money back. I live in NW OKC. Feel free to text me at REDACTED, thank you.



Here's some more info:

 Propel AO


An all-purpose tactical knife needs to feel familiar and capable, like a well-worn tool, yet still offer quick action and hold up to long-term use. Drawing on critical feedback from military and law enforcement personnel plus its decades of knife design experience, Gerber set out to design a full-size, assisted-opening knife that’s as easy to handle and carry as it is durable and capable. The Gerber Propel AO knife is this knife. It’s a full-size tactical knife with a slim handle profile that fits comfortably in your pocket and hand.

Built to Last
A tactical knife is sure to see a variety of uses, so Gerber uses 420 high-carbon steel to give you a dependable edge. Add a G-10 composite handle and you’ve got an incredibly durable knife. Additionally, the Propel AO features a safer deployment than that of most AO knives. In deploying the blade of a typical Assisted Open knife, users simply apply pressure to the ambidextrous thumb stud. However, in the case of the Propel AO, instead of applying pressure upwards and parallel to the knife’s case, the blade will deploy when engaged at about 45 degrees to the side. This, along with the knife’s narrow aperture of blade access, ensures the blade doesn’t deploy accidentally while being pulled with speed from the pocket. Once the blade is engaged it can be locked into place during use. The tanto-style blade’s black oxide coating adds a stealth element, while its partial serration adds all-purpose utility for working through stubborn materials like nylon rope and thick plastic.

Adjustable Clip
Personal preference dictates how you carry your knife, so Gerber designed the Propel AO with a three-way adjustable clip to customize the knife’s orientation in your pocket or on your belt. You can set it for tip-up or tip-down storage and left-hand or right-hand bias

Comfortable, Discreet Carry
To deserve daily use status, a utilitarian knife like the Propel AO needs to feel good in your hand and in your pocket. The composite G-10 handle’s textured surface optimizes grip security in all conditions and maintains a slim profile that complements the knife’s balanced feel, while the reliable plunge lock and safety switch secure the blade where you want it, be it open or stowed in your pocket. But most importantly, you get a full-size tactical knife that carries discreetly and comfortably, on the job and off.


http://www.gerbergear.com/Tactical/Knives/Propel-AO_30-000698

title: For Sale/Trade:  Sold Pending Funds
postcontent:
Selling my RIA 1911A2 chambered in .22TCM with a 9mm conversion set. Also included in sale is 235 factory loaded rounds, and 110 once fired brass cases (if the buyer wants them, if not I'll toss them in my brass pile). 

This firearm is in excellent shape, well taken care of and lightly used. All required to switch from .22TCM to 9mm or vice-versa is to swap the extractor, barrel, and recoil spring (takes approximately 5 minutes). The .22TCM  is a blazing fast cartridge at over 2,000fps. I ruined a buddy's pistol spinner target using this handgun (1/8" steel plate, and it nearly punched through the back). Light recoil, high capacity (17+1 in either caliber), and large muzzle blasts in low light make this firearm tons of fun. Selling because I bought it for my girlfriend for a home defense weapon in 9mm, and the grip is too big for her hands. I can't justify keeping it around just for me, so I'm making room in the safe for something she'll be able to use.

DPMS-SGC Classic Caliber .223 Straight Pull Rifle

This rifle is in great condition, with hardly any use since new. The internal parts are clean and show very little signs of wear and tear on the following: Bolt, hammer, inside of action and the dust Cover.

This gun shoots perfectly and extracts cartridges smoothly. The bolt is very smooth.

The rifle has had a few upgrade parts added from stock, with a .223 Wylde DPMS 1-8 twist Barrel, A4 Stock and MilSpec Buffer Tube.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Smith & Wesson model 25-3 125th anniversary edition
postcontent: Here's a very nice Smith & Wesson 125th Anniversary Commemorative that appears to be unfired!. This is a Model 25-3 made in 1977 to mark S&W's 125th year in business. Built on the big N-frame, this revolver chambers the .45 Long Colt cartridge and wears a pinned 6-1/2" heavy barrel with adjustable rear sight. The barrel is marked "SMITH & WESSON 125th ANNIVERSARY" and the sideplate has the 125th Commemorative seal, both gold filled. It also has a special "S&W" prefix serial number. Has the smooth target grips, target hammer, and target trigger. Overall condition is excellent, virtually new. The original blue finish rates 99%+ with only a faint cylinder turn line. The grips are exellent as well with no significant wear. The mechanics appear to be in perfect working order and both timing and lock-up are excellent. The bore is also like new and shows no wear. This nice revolver comes in a lockable, 125th Anniversary wooden case with blue velvet interior (one key is included). Inside, there is space for a nickel silver 125th Anniversary medallion as well as a copy of a signed Roy Jink's book "125 Years With Smith & Wesson"...a detailed hard-bound 290-page history of one of the greatest gun makers in American history. The book is in new condition. A super nice revolver, this would make a fine collectible or an excellent shooter.

title: For Sale:  New Limited Edition Wiley Clapp Hawkeye GP100 - $800 OBO
postcontent:
I'm selling my Wiley Clapp GP100 in Stainless "Hawkeye" finish. 

This gun is the result of a collaboration between Ruger and famous gun writer Wiley Clapp in an attempt to make a GP100 more suited for self defense and carry use. It has a 3" barrel with Novak rear and fiber optic front sights. The finish is a stainless matte with a hybrid rubber and engraved wood grip. 

It's one of the most comfortable large revolvers to carry and shoot. If you know the GP100 then you know that this gun will never quit. You can feed tens of thousands rounds through it without so much as a cleaning. It will never get out of time or break. This version also happens to be a very handsome gun. 

These are completely sold out at every broker. If you're lucky you'll find a blue one at a gun show but the stainless ones are extremely difficult to find. This gun has only been to the range one time. I fired about 80 rounds through it to break it in and now I'm selling it. It's a great gun but I don't see myself carrying it very often so I'd rather sell it. 

The price is negotiable and I'm open to any reasonable offer.

CASH ONLY
